img.alt: Julie Wardlaw wins 2020 Parent of the Year

a.span: Lovett Elementary mother Julie Wardlaw wins CPSD Parent of the Year

a.title: Go to comments for Lovett Elementary mother Julie Wardlaw wins CPSD Parent of the Year

img.alt: Dr. Tim Martin, Mina Darnell, Brett Robinson and Anthony Goins

a.span: CHS math teacher Mina Darnell named Second Congressional District Teacher of the Year

div.p: Clinton Public School District's Teacher of the Year Mina Darnell is one of four teachers in contention for the State Teacher of the Year award.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS math teacher Mina Darnell named Second Congressional District Teacher of the Year

img.alt: Ray Freeman, Uyen Tran, and Dylan Parker

a.span: Keystone program offers college and career readiness

div.p: Keystone is a career and college readiness course for ninth graders. This introductory course includes content in self-development, career clusters, pathways, and choices, as well as financial planning. The students learn multiple transferable skills that prepare them for interviews and potential job positions in the future.

a.title: Go to comments for Keystone program offers college and career readiness

a.span: EL teacher wins DOVE customer service award

div.p: Charanza-Stovall is the recipient of the Dedication of Our Valued Employees or DOVE customer service award for the month of February. This is her second time to win this award.

a.title: Go to comments for EL teacher wins DOVE customer service award

div.p: Lifelong Clintonian and Clinton High School graduate Robert Chapman is the Clinton Public School Districts new public information officer. He replaces Sandi Beason, who is leaving the district to work in another industry.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD welcomes new PR person

div.p: Today the Clinton Public School District received a Beacon Award, the highest award given by the Mississippi School Boards Association, for the strength of its academic programs. Clinton is an A-rated school district and the third highest-achieving school district in Mississippi.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD wins Beacon Award

img.alt: Lady Arrows track team running (large group)

a.span: Track teams prepare for championship season

div.p: The Clinton Arrow Track and Field team is striving for success once again. They finished their indoor season at the Last Chance Invitational in Birmingham, Ala. with multiple personal records and podium appearances.

a.title: Go to comments for Track teams prepare for championship season

img.alt: Aaron Graves, Victor Yen, Kevin Zhang and Isaac Martinolich

div.p: Aaron Graves, Isaac Martinolich, Victor Yen and Kevin Zhang are National Merit Finalists. More than 1.6 million students enter the program nationwide; there are roughly 16,000 semifinalists; and about 7,600 are chosen as scholarship recipients

a.title: Go to comments for CHS honors 2020 National Merit Finalists

img.alt: Abigail Young, Cutlas Frazier, Olivia Rees and Griffin Berch

a.span: Ninth-graders learn personal finance at Sumner Hill Reality Fair

div.p: Ninth-graders got a practical lesson in personal finance this week at the Sumner Hill Junior High School Reality Fair.

a.title: Go to comments for Ninth-graders learn personal finance at Sumner Hill Reality Fair

img.alt: Bo Barksdale, Larry Thompson and Paula DeYoung

div.p: Congratulations to Larry Thompson (center), the Clinton Public School District's Maintenance Employee of the Year! This award is given annually to a Maintenance Department employee based on voting by school district employees. This is Thompson's third time to win this award. Presenting his award are (from left) Maintenance Director Bo Barksdale and School Board President Paula DeYoung.

a.title: Go to comments for Maintenance Employee of the Year

a.span: Ambassadors compete at MS Show Choir Contest

div.p: At the Mississippi State Show Choir Contest, Clinton's junior show choir, The Ambassadors, received a Superior rating, RiverRoad Award (spirit of Show Choir), Best Individual Soloist (Emmia Garner), Best Male Performer (Marcus Pollard), and second place overall in the Middle School division.

a.title: Go to comments for Ambassadors compete at MS Show Choir Contest

img.alt: Dr. Brock Ratcliff, Aaron Zmitrovich, and Anthony Goins

a.span: Clinton student wins Hinds County Spelling Bee

div.p: Aaron competed against 58 other students from Jackson, Clinton and Hinds County schools to win the county competition, held Feb. 5 at the CJHS Auditorium

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton student wins Hinds County Spelling Bee

a.span: Ambassadors win Grand Champion at JA tourney

div.p: Clinton's junior show choir, The Ambassadors, competed in the Jackson Academy Show Choir Invitational on Friday, Jan. 31. This was the first competition of the season for The Ambassadors, and they won GrandChampion of the Middle School division, Best Overall Effect, Best Vocals and Natalie Pace was awarded the Best Individual Soloist.

a.title: Go to comments for Ambassadors win Grand Champion at JA tourney

a.span: Northside assistant teacher wins customer service award

div.p: Alicia Scott is the kind of teacher who works with all students and looks for ways to help others in the classroom.

a.title: Go to comments for Northside assistant teacher wins customer service award

img.alt: Dr. Virgil Belue (left) and Mr. Joe Ricketts

div.p: Joe Ricketts, right, founder and former CEO of TD Ameritrade, visited the Clinton Public School District to learn more about its grade structure, equity in education and the high standards CPSD sets for all students

a.title: Go to comments for Billionaire visits CPSD

a.span: Clyatt appointed state advocate for speech-language-hearing

div.p: Melanie Clyatt, speech-language pathologist in the Clinton Public School District, was appointed State Education Advocacy Leader for the Mississippi Speech-Language-Hearing Association for 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for Clyatt appointed state advocate for speech-language-hearing

img.alt: Virgil Belue, Barbie Ferguson and Tim Martin

div.p: The Clinton Chamber of Commerce held its annual banquet this week, celebrating the work of the Chamber for 2019, outlining its focus for 2020 and honoring outstanding businesses and individuals in Clinton.

a.title: Go to comments for Chamber of Commerce Awards

img.alt: Lovett gifted students in hazmat suits (group)

a.span: Lovett, CHS Career Complex hold Forensic Fair

div.p: Sixth graders at Lovett participated in the fourth annual Forensic Science Fair. The fair was a partnership between the ACCENT program at Lovett and Jeff Franks, a former Evidence Response Team member of the FBI, and students from his Law & Public Safety class at the Clinton High School Career Complex. The ACCENT students are learning about 14 forensic sciences.

a.title: Go to comments for Lovett, CHS Career Complex hold Forensic Fair

a.span: School Board honors Rising Arrow award winners

div.p: The Rising Arrow student award honors students who are quietly working to make the world a better place.

a.title: Go to comments for School Board honors Rising Arrow award winners

img.alt: Clinton High School student performing in a play

a.span: Clinton theatre brings home awards at regional competition

div.p: Nearly two dozen Clinton theatre students attended the North Mississippi High School DramaFest competition recently in Starkville and brought home top awards.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton theatre brings home awards at regional competition

div.p: Attache' Show Choir's alumni dinner theatre is set for Jan. 25. The fundraising event combines delicious cuisine, a silent auction and amazing talent on stage.

a.title: Go to comments for Attache' plans Alumni Dinner Theatre

a.span: Sumner Hill coach wins DOVE Award for December

div.p: Stanford is the recipient of the Clinton Public School Districts Dedication of Our Valued Employees or DOVE customer service award for the month of December.

a.title: Go to comments for Sumner Hill coach wins DOVE Award for December

div.p: Clinton High School is proud to announce Emnet Alemayehu as a recipient of the 2019 QuestBridge National College Match

a.title: Go to comments for Full scholarship to Rice University

div.p: The sounds of construction fill the air at Clinton High School and Clinton Junior High, and very soon, several other campuses.

a.title: Go to comments for Construction, communication on CPSD's 2020 agenda

img.alt: (from left) Tim Martin, Tamikia Billings and Anthony Goins

a.span: Tamikia Billings is CPSD Administrator of the Year

div.p: Clinton Junior High School Principal Tamikia Billings (center) is the Clinton Public School District's 2019-20 Administrator of the Year

a.title: Go to comments for Tamikia Billings is CPSD Administrator of the Year

a.span: Mina Darnell is CPSD's 2019-20 Teacher of the Year

div.p: Darnell was named the Clinton Public School Districts 2019-20 Teacher of the Year. She received the award in a surprise presentation at CHS.

a.title: Go to comments for Mina Darnell is CPSD's 2019-20 Teacher of the Year

a.span: Clinton schools recognize Rising Arrows for first nine weeks

div.p: The Rising Arrow student award honors students who are quietly working to make the world a better place.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton schools recognize Rising Arrows for first nine weeks

a.span: Attache' show choir 40th Anniversary Fall Revue set for Dec. 11-14

div.p: Nationally acclaimed for four decades, Clinton Highs Attach show choir will shine on stage before audiences at its 2019 Fall Revue.

a.title: Go to comments for Attache' show choir 40th Anniversary Fall Revue set for Dec. 11-14

div.p: Emerson is the recipient of the Clinton Public School Districts Dedication of Our Valued Employees or DOVE customer service award for the month of November

a.title: Go to comments for CHS receptionist wins DOVE award

img.alt: Zoie Chambers, Katie Tracy, Trace Arthur, Blake Little and Brad Pope

a.span: Freshmen rank high in Boss Challenge

div.p: For the past eight weeks, these students managed a business and competed against juniors and seniors from several schools in Arkansas. Sumner Hill placed second overall in total profits and also placed second in their presentation to the Board of Directors

a.title: Go to comments for Freshmen rank high in Boss Challenge

img.alt: Northside students (from left) Katie Rhodes and Koreigh Sprowles

a.span: Northside Elementary honors veterans at annual program

div.p: During the Veterans Day program, LTC Marcos Rogers spoke to students about what it means to sacrifice for others and how it is our duty to help those who cant help themselves. Music teacher Nancy Leigh Strum led students in several patriotic songs. Students involved in Boy Scouts or Girl Scouts were encouraged to wear their scouting uniforms.

a.title: Go to comments for Northside Elementary honors veterans at annual program

a.span: CHS Academic Teams compete in Ole Miss Brain Brawl

div.p: Clinton High School took three academic teams to Ole Miss last weekend for their Fall Brain Brawl. The A team (pictured) made it all the way to the quarter finals.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS Academic Teams compete in Ole Miss Brain Brawl

img.alt: Members of the Arrow Court (large group)

div.p: Congratulations to the members of the Clinton High School 2019 Arrow Court! The court will be presented Tuesday, Dec. 10 during halftime of the CHS Boys Basketball game. Prior to the game, the court will also be recognized at a pep rally on the morning of Dec. 10 at CHS.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS announces 2019 Arrow Court

a.span: Clinton teacher joins NBCT Mississippi executive board

div.p: The Mississippi NBCT Network held its first Learn and Lead Conference this past Saturday at Hinds Community College's Muse Center in Pearl. Among the day's activities, they elected the inaugural members of its executive committee. The NBCT Network is sponsored by Mississippi Professional Educators.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton teacher joins NBCT Mississippi executive board

div.p: Students from various schools divided into teams of 6-8 people each to compete in the STEM Challenge, which used math and science skills to solve problems and construct a tower with limited supplies. CHS teams placed second and third in the competition. Lunch was served followed by a keynote speaker.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS students attend STEM event

img.alt: Two northside students dissect owl pellets

a.span: Northside students dissect owl pellets and learn about bats and owls

div.p: Second-graders at Northside are dissecting owl pellets. They have been reading Stellaluna and learning about bats and owls. This is a great way to infuse science into language arts, and the kids had a blast!

a.title: Go to comments for Northside students dissect owl pellets and learn about bats and owls

img.alt: Northside students (group) and the spider legs box

a.span: 'Fear Factor' makes Halloween fun, educational at Northside

div.p: Northside teachers made Halloween fun and educational during the "Fear Factor" program. Students visited different stations for hands-on challenges, and ended the unit with spooky treats. Thanks to all the Northside teachers who make learning fun for their students!

a.title: Go to comments for 'Fear Factor' makes Halloween fun, educational at Northside

img.alt: CHS students (large group) in Halloween costumes

a.span: CHS students 'trick or treat' with elderly

div.p: Career Pathway Experience students from Clinton High School/Career Complex participated in a Halloween service project at Brookedale Senior Living in Clinton, MS. Students dressed in costume as the residents "trick or treated" with them. Residents and students enjoyed the afternoon! This event was student-led and facilitated.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS students 'trick or treat' with elderly

a.span: Attache' holds Christmas Cash Raffle fundraiser

div.p: Attache' show choir's Christmas Cash Raffle is happening now! Each raffle ticket is $5 and there will be a $500 cash drawing each night of the Attache' Fall Revue (Dec. 11-14). You do not have to be present to win. Contact any Attache' singer/dancer, pit, or crew member to purchase a ticket or call 601-924-0707.

a.title: Go to comments for Attache' holds Christmas Cash Raffle fundraiser

img.alt: Ole Miss Chancellor Dr. Glenn Boyce speaks to CHS students

a.span: Ole Miss Chancellor visits Clinton High School

div.p: Dr. Glenn Boyce, newly appointed chancellor of the University of Mississippi, recently visited Clinton High School as part of a statewide tour of Mississippi high schools. While at CHS, he met with faculty members and students to gather feedback and share information about Ole Miss.

a.title: Go to comments for Ole Miss Chancellor visits Clinton High School

a.span: CHS student is Miss Capital City's Outstanding Teen

div.p: Sarah Beth is a junior at CHS, an honor student, Attache singer/dancer, and a student council officer. She will represent her title at the Miss Mississippi Outstanding Teen pageant in Vicksburg in April.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS student is Miss Capital City's Outstanding Teen

a.span: Clinton Junior High assistant principal wins customer service award

div.p: For Clinton Junior High School Assistant Principal Drew Wardlaw, its about making sure every student knows someone cares.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton Junior High assistant principal wins customer service award

img.alt: Kristen Mullins, Tomi Phan and Richard Puckett

a.span: Fifth grader wins Eastside Spelling Bee

a.title: Go to comments for Fifth grader wins Eastside Spelling Bee
Go to comments for Ninth-graders commit to graduate

img.alt: Life skills students (group) with the Arrow Brew coffee cart

a.span: Life Skills students serve up Arrow Brew at CHS

div.p: CHS received a $500 grant from the Central Mississippi Down Syndrome Society to start the school-based enterprise. The goal, she said, is to teach her students valuable social skills, how to fill orders, sharing, interactions in a work environment, health and hygiene, and other basic functions of business.

a.title: Go to comments for Life Skills students serve up Arrow Brew at CHS

img.alt: Jane hugs her dad, Pvt. Joao Kratochvil

a.span: Soldier surprises kindergarten daughter at Clinton Park

div.p: For grown-ups, eight months may not seem like a long time but when you're a kindergartener, it can feel like an eternity. That's how long it's been since Clinton Park Elementary School student Jane Kratochvil has seen her father, Army Private Joao Kratochvil, who has been in training at Ft. Gordon in Georgia and Ft. Jackson in South Carolina.

a.title: Go to comments for Soldier surprises kindergarten daughter at Clinton Park

div.p: To fund this project, Ferguson was recently awarded a $1,000 grant from Mississippi Professional Educators. She is one of two Clinton teachers who received a classroom grant from MPE this year.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton teachers awarded classroom grants

a.span: Attache' performs at Continental Grand Opening Ceremony

div.p: This historic grand opening is extra special for four Attache' members. Kameryn Trejo, Rowdy Hutchison, Emily Ouellette, and Taylor May were members of Attache' in 2015-2016 when the show choir was asked to perform at Continental Tire's economic development announcement and signing ceremony.

a.title: Go to comments for Attache' performs at Continental Grand Opening Ceremony

a.span: Clinton gifted teacher wins statewide award

div.p: Eastside Elementary teacher Lisa Saucier is the recipient of the 2019 Frances A. Karnes Award for Excellence in Gifted Education.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton gifted teacher wins statewide award

img.alt: State Superintendent Carey Wright and Clinton students (large group)

div.p: State Superintendent of Education Dr. Carey Wright on Wednesday visited the Clinton Public School District as part of the 2019 Celebration of Excellence tour of A-rated districts. CPSD's overall score this year is 729, up nearly 20 points from last year's 711. It is the third-highest scoring school district in Mississippi and the highest achieving in the Jackson metro area.

a.title: Go to comments for State Superintendent visits CPSD

img.alt: Coach Trave Hopkins and EL students

a.span: AIM program at CHS helps EL students

div.p: At Clinton High School, there is a group of students who volunteer to mentor and assist English Language Learners with the transition to a new environment. The Arrow Intercultural Mentors or AIM program provides a student-based support system for students whose native language is not English.

a.title: Go to comments for AIM program at CHS helps EL students

img.alt: Tiffany Nguyen is awarded her United States citizenship

a.span: Clinton High School Student Tiffany Thu Nguyen earns US citizenship

div.p: Tiffany Thu Nguyen thought the U.S. Citizenship test would be difficult, so she was well prepared. Its hard if English is your second language, she said. It wasnt easy but I learned it. And I tried really hard and learned about the culture and how to be a good citizen.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton High School Student Tiffany Thu Nguyen earns US citizenship

a.span: Bus driver wins customer service award

div.p: Bus driver Jimmy Creel greets all of his students with a smile and kind word every day when they step onto his bus. His words and actions have not gone unnoticed; Creel is the recipient of the Dedication of Our Valued Employees or DOVE customer service award for the month of September.

a.title: Go to comments for Bus driver wins customer service award

a.span: Dual credit courses growing in popularity at Clinton High School

div.p: Students at Clinton High School have the opportunity to earn college credit through several dual credit course options. Clinton High School partners with Hinds Community College and Mississippi College to offer students dual credit options their 11th and 12th grade years.

a.title: Go to comments for Dual credit courses growing in popularity at Clinton High School

img.alt: From left, Justin Odom, Nhat Van, Will Harrell, Josie Nasekos and Clark Hensley

a.span: CHS Computer Science course teaches coding, critical thinking

div.p: In its second year at the Clinton High School Career Complex, the Computer Science Principles course is providing college-level coursework for CHS students.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS Computer Science course teaches coding, critical thinking

a.span: CPSD maintains strong 'A' rating as a district

div.p: Not only is the Clinton Public School District an A-rated district, this year it moved from the fifth- to third-highest achieving school district in Mississippi.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD maintains strong 'A' rating as a district

img.alt: From left - Priyanka Patel, Karam Kaur, Hardin Copeland and Sgt. Al Kimbrell

a.span: CHS students serve as interns with Clinton Police Department

div.p: In partnership with the Clinton Police Department, Karam, Hardin and Priyanka served as police interns this summer, getting hands-on experience in the field. Their work during the drill was one of many activities the students experienced as interns.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS students serve as interns with Clinton Police Department

img.alt: Pyper Griffin and Justin Threatt playing chess

a.span: CJHS Chess Club prepares for competition

div.p: Chess is a newly-sanctioned activity by the MHSAA and Clinton students are practicing and preparing for competitions.

a.title: Go to comments for CJHS Chess Club prepares for competition

img.alt: CTE classes are under construction at Clinton High School

a.span: Despite rain, construction progressing at Clinton schools

div.p: Funds from the 2018 bond issue are being used to construct new Career and Technical Education facilities on the main campus of Clinton High School, and also renovations to Clinton Junior High.

a.title: Go to comments for Despite rain, construction progressing at Clinton schools

a.span: CPSD test scores among highest in state

div.p: According to state test scores released by the Mississippi Department of Education, 93 percent of Clinton fourth-graders passed the English Language Arts state test (scoring a 3, 4 or 5), and a whopping 98.6 percent of Clinton fourth-graders passed the math state test.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD test scores among highest in state

a.span: Clinton Park holds Parent Academy for preschool children

div.p: Through a partnership with the Barksdale Reading Institute, Clinton Park Elementary is planning an outreach program for parents of pre-kindergarten age children.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton Park holds Parent Academy for preschool children

a.span: CPSD is No. 1 in Mississippi in teacher quality

div.p: We have highly qualified teachers at every grade level, in every subject, in every school, said Dr. Tim Martin, superintendent of schools. Great teachers make all the difference, and every day theyre impacting the lives of children in our community.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD is No. 1 in Mississippi in teacher quality

img.alt: Dr. Clay Norton, Dr. Veressa Coyt, and Heather McKinion

a.span: Three CPSD teachers join Mississippi Teacher Council

div.p: Each year, the Mississippi Department of Education selects teachers from across the state to serve on this council and provide feedback to Dr. Carey Wright, state superintendent of education. Formed in 2016, the Mississippi Teacher Council now includes 381 educators.

a.title: Go to comments for Three CPSD teachers join Mississippi Teacher Council

a.span: CPSD tests crisis plan, procedures in active shooter drill

div.p: CPSD partnered with the city of Clinton and the Clinton Police Department to test all aspects of its plan and procedures for an active shooter scenario. During the drill, the school and law enforcement responded to a simulated shooting that resulted in multiple injuries and fatalities.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD tests crisis plan, procedures in active shooter drill

img.alt: Lady Arrows Track & Field group photo

a.span: 2018-19 a great year for Arrow Athletics

div.p: Clinton Arrow Athletics closed out the 2019 Athletic year with much to be proud of, boasting numerous individual and team accomplishments.

a.title: Go to comments for 2018-19 a great year for Arrow Athletics

a.span: Arrows football season tickets on sale in July, August

div.p: The tickets will be on sale between 9 a.m. and 2 p.m. Monday through Friday. Last year's reserved season ticket holders will have until Friday, Aug. 2 to reclaim their seats from last year.

a.title: Go to comments for Arrows football season tickets on sale in July, August

div.p: To earn this distinction, Fortenberry has demonstrated the highest level of knowledge and expertise in the field of interscholastic athletic administration. The voluntary certification process included a thorough evaluation of the candidate's educational background, experience and professional contributions, as well as a rigorous, comprehensive written evaluation.

a.title: Go to comments for Athletic Director earns national certification

a.span: Track coach is finalist for National Girls Track Coach of the Year

div.p: Johnathan Perkins, head coach for both boys and girls track & field teams at Clinton High School, was recognized this week as one of eight finalists for the 2019 NHSACA Coach of the Year - Track & Field.

a.title: Go to comments for Track coach is finalist for National Girls Track Coach of the Year

a.span: Percussion director takes on Interim Band Director role

div.p: Gavin McAdams replaces Kevin Welborn, who announced this summer hes accepted a position at the University of Alabama.

a.title: Go to comments for Percussion director takes on Interim Band Director role

a.span: CPSD earns national PR award for 2018 Bond Campaign

div.p: Voters in September passed a $25 million school bond by an overwhelming 95% approval. This summer, the Clinton Public School District will receive a national award for the success of this campaign. CPSD is the only Mississippi school district to receive a 2019 Golden Achievement award from the National School PR Association.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD earns national PR award for 2018 Bond Campaign

a.span: CHS student selected to serve on Mississippi Board of Education

div.p: "As a representative, I would keep in mind all of my peers and keep in mind what would be beneficial for all of them, not just now but in the long run, so that they can grow as peers, friends and eventually leaders in the state of Mississippi," she said.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS student selected to serve on Mississippi Board of Education

a.span: CPSD seeks business partners for Teacher Incentive Package program

div.p: In this program, businesses are asked to offer across-the-board discounts or one-time promotions for Clinton educators.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD seeks business partners for Teacher Incentive Package program

a.span: Clinton among top districts on 3rd grade reading scores

div.p: The Literacy-Based Promotion Act requires third-graders to pass a reading assessment to qualify for promotion to fourth grade. This year the minimum benchmark to pass the test was raised, resulting in a dip in scores statewide.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton among top districts on 3rd grade reading scores

div.p: This years class has 360 graduates, with 155 students accepting $5.9 million in scholarships to 35 colleges and universities throughout the nation. Ninety students are graduating with honors 26% of the graduating class.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS celebrates the class of 2019

a.span: CHS, CJHS hire new assistant principals

div.p: Cody Zumbro will be an assistant principal at CJHS and Matthew Fulton at Clinton High School

a.title: Go to comments for CHS, CJHS hire new assistant principals

a.span: School Board honors fourth nine-weeks Rising Arrow award winners

div.p: This award is given to students who display good character and integrity, and is based on nominations from faculty and staff at each school. The Rising Arrow award is given to one student per school per nine weeks period during the school year.

a.title: Go to comments for School Board honors fourth nine-weeks Rising Arrow award winners

a.span: Sumner Hill cafeteria manager wins customer service award

div.p: Aisha Jones greets students and teachers with a smile and kind word when they come through the line in the Sumner Hill Junior High School cafeteria.

a.title: Go to comments for Sumner Hill cafeteria manager wins customer service award

img.alt: There are 34 total seniors this year and 24 received scholarships

a.span: Band students receive more than $160K in scholarships

div.p: Of 34 senior band students at Clinton High School, 24 have received scholarships to continue band in college

a.title: Go to comments for Band students receive more than $160K in scholarships

a.span: CHS student selected for National Trumpet Competition

div.p: Congratulations to Clinton High School student Mariah Atwood on being selected for the prestigious National Trumpet Competition! Mariah was the only Mississippi participant in the high school division. Taking place at the University of Kentucky this past weekend, this was the largest solo instrument competition in the world and ranges from high school, collegiate level, as well as professional level solo and ensemble artists.

img.alt: Melanie Clyatt demonstrates the Spark Speech app

a.span: Faculty create app to help with speech therapy

div.p: Multisyllabic words can be extremely difficult for those with speech problems such as apraxia, phonological disorders or severe articulation disorders. The flashcard-style app allows for targeted practice of two-, three-, and four-syllable words utilizing realistic pictures.

a.title: Go to comments for Faculty create app to help with speech therapy

a.span: Fourth-graders write, sell their own books

div.p: Students created two interactive books, The Game of Bros and Alien Invasion. The premise behind the idea was for each class to create their own interactive fiction novel in which the reader chooses the plot and the outcome of the story. The students brainstormed as a class and created a large web that explained the different parts of the adventure and assigned a student to write each section.

div.p: What started as a way for English language learners to practice speaking English turned into something much bigger. It turned into a way for them to make friends and become more comfortable in their school home, said Clinton High School sociology teacher Sherri Ottis. It also gave them a chance to share their culture with the students in their new school, many of whom had never tasted some of the foreign foods.

img.alt: Clinton is an A Rated District for the 2018-19 school year

a.span: CPSD earns 'A' Rating; fifth-highest overall score statewide

div.p: According to ratings released this week by the Mississippi Department of Education, the Clinton Public School District is an A-Rated district, the highest possible academic rating a Mississippi school district can attain. With its overall score of 711, CPSD is the fifth-highest achieving district statewide.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD earns 'A' Rating; fifth-highest overall score statewide

a.span: Clinton schools recognize Rising Arrows for first nine-weeks

div.p: We began this award to recognize students who demonstrate integrity and good character, said Dr. Tim Martin, superintendent of schools. They help others in need, both at school and in their community. They are kind to others. They do the right thing without being asked, only because its the right thing to do. The Rising Arrow award is a way to say thank you for being good people, and not just good students.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton schools recognize Rising Arrows for first nine-weeks

div.p: Getting kids up and active is the heart behind the brand-new running club, called the Arrow Runners, at Lovett Elementary School.

div.p: The coveted Blue Ribbon award affirms the hard work of educators, families and communities in creating safe and welcoming schools where students master challenging and engaging content.

a.span: CHS junior Kevin Zhang aces ACT

div.p: Clinton High School junior Kevin Zhang did the happy dance when he found out he scored perfect on the ACT. I just started jumping around, he said. His parents were really surprised. They didnt think I would make perfect.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS junior Kevin Zhang aces ACT

img.alt: Eastside student group, all wearing Clinton Arrow red

div.p: We were recently rated the No. 1 school district in the Jackson metro area, as well as the safest district and best place to teach, said Dr. Tim Martin, superintendent of schools. We are a great option for families who are serious about their childrens education, and were glad to see our enrollment at this level.

a.title: Go to comments for Enrollment holds steady at 5,300

a.span: Students offered multiple options for high school graduation

div.p: Beginning with the 2018-19 freshman class, students will be able to customize their high school experience by choosing from four different degree options. Available diploma tracks include Traditional Diploma, Career and Technical Education Endorsement, Academic Endorsement, or Distinguished Academic Diploma. Each option sets up the students for success after graduation whether they go on to college, the work force, a career and technical program or the military.

a.title: Go to comments for Students offered multiple options for high school graduation

a.span: Bus driver wins DOVE customer service award

div.p: Creel is the recipient of the Clinton Public School Districts Dedication of Our Valued Employees, or DOVE, customer service award for the month of September. He will be recognized at the school board meeting on Tuesday, Oct. 9 at Central Office. He looks out for all the children and always is in a good mood and has a smile and tells the kids to have a good day, said parent Paula Arrington, in nominating Creel for the award. He goes out of his way to be polite to parents and children.

a.title: Go to comments for Bus driver wins DOVE customer service award

a.span: Clark Hensley a National Merit Semifinalist

div.p: He scored perfect on the ACT, twice. Now, Clinton High School senior Clark Hensley has been named a National Merit Semifinalist. This designation comes from high scores on the PSAT as a junior, and Clark is now eligible to become a National Merit Finalist in the spring.

a.title: Go to comments for Clark Hensley a National Merit Semifinalist

img.alt: Dr. Matt Thomas, Clinton School Board President

div.p: On behalf of the Clinton Public School District Board of Trustees, students, faculty and staff, I would like to thank voters for your overwhelming support of the $25 million 2018 school bond referendum on Sept. 11.

a.title: Go to comments for Thank you!

div.p: Of 2,369 votes cast, 2,133 voted in favor of the bond issue and 107 voted against, a 95 percent approval rate. With the passing of this bond issue, it shows that Clinton is looking toward the future and is willing, as a community, to improve the facilities where we are shaping our children for their futures, said Dr. Tim Martin, superintendent of schools. It is wonderful to see our community coming out to support the district so strongly.

a.title: Go to comments for Voters overwhelmingly pass bond issue

a.span: CPSD launches 'We Are Arrow Nation' community campaign

div.p: There is a new look and feel to the Clinton Public School District announcements and publications. We launched the We Are Arrow Nation campaign this summer as a unifying theme for our community, said Public Information Officer Sandi Beason.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD launches 'We Are Arrow Nation' community campaign

a.span: Clinton schools seek voter approval for $25M bond issue

div.p: After nearly a decade of annual increases in enrollment, the Clinton Public School Districts facilities are at capacity. The Clinton School Board on Tuesday voted unanimously to seek voter approval for a $25 million bond issue for facility upgrades throughout the district. The bond issue should not require a tax increase, based on economic projections with Continental Tire manufacturing plant and citywide growth.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton schools seek voter approval for $25M bond issue

a.span: Clinton students earn high scores in 2017-18 state testing

div.p: Clinton Public School District scores show staggering increases in fourth-grade English Language Arts, growing from 48.8 percent proficiency last year to 78.2 percent this year. Fourth-graders also jumped from 67.9 percent proficiency in math last year to 83 percent this year. Another significant number is student growth, which measures whether students show a years worth of learning for a years worth of teaching. In fourth grade, students showed 107 percent growth overall in math, with the bottom 25 percent of students showing 89 percent.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton students earn high scores in 2017-18 state testing

a.span: Donny Gray to lead CPSD Transportation Department

div.p: Donny Gray makes safety a priority when it comes to school buses. Safety is a choice, not a chance, he said. We do our best to be safe at all times. Gray is the Clinton Public School Districts new director of transportation, replacing Terry Harris who recently retired. Prior to this role, he worked at UPS for 37 years and more recently was Transportation Director at the Mississippi Department of Education.

a.title: Go to comments for Donny Gray to lead CPSD Transportation Department

a.span: PowerSchool allows access to grades, registration

div.p: Like in years past, parents have access to grade information and online registration through the PowerSchool parent portal

a.title: Go to comments for PowerSchool allows access to grades, registration

img.alt: CPSD seeks business partners for Teacher Incentive Package

a.span: CPSD seeks business partners for Teacher Incentive Package

div.p: The Clinton Public School District is going paperless with the annual Teacher Incentive Package program. For the tenth year, CPSD is partnering with area businesses and community organizations in an effort to recruit and retain great teachers. Through the Teacher Incentive Package, businesses are asked to offer across-the-board discounts or one-time offers for Clinton educators.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD seeks business partners for Teacher Incentive Package

a.span: 99 percent of CPSD third-graders pass reading test

div.p: Nearly all of Clintons third-graders passed the recent reading state test and will move to fourth grade this fall. The Clinton Public School District enrolls 449 third graders, and only one did not meet the requirements for promotion. Mississippis Literacy-Based Promotion Act requires that all third-graders must pass this test before they can pass to fourth grade, with some exceptions for learning disabilities.

a.title: Go to comments for 99 percent of CPSD third-graders pass reading test

img.alt: 15 CHS band students accepted marching scholarships

div.p: Six members received scholarship offers for band to Hinds Community College, and nine members received offers to Mississippi State University, University of Mississippi, Delta State University, Mississippi College, Jackson State University, University of Southern Mississippi, and University of Memphis.

a.title: Go to comments for 15 CHS students receive band scholarships

img.alt: The Clinton School Board honored Rising Arrow winners at the May meeting.

a.span: Rising Arrow Award winners announced for fourth nine weeks

div.p: There are hundreds of children in Clintons public schools who are not on honor roll, not the star of their sports team, or not the top of their class. But they come to school every day and do their work, they are courteous to teachers and staff, they help other students and they excel in ways that may not be quantified. The new Rising Arrow award honors students who are quietly working to make the world a better place.

a.title: Go to comments for Rising Arrow Award winners announced for fourth nine weeks

img.alt: Graduation is 7:30 p.m. Friday, May 25 at Mississippi College

div.p: Members of the class of 2018 are leaving Clinton High School with more than $6 million in scholarships to colleges and universities across the country.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS celebrates class of 2018

a.span: Culture & Arts Fest at CHS a success

div.p: We had several student clubs sponsor this event, including National Art Honor Society, Cultural Awareness Society, Poetry Club and Thespian Troupe 7314 of the National Thespian Society, said event co-organizer and CHS student Regina Hunsinger. Her classmate Sahil Patel also organized the event.

a.title: Go to comments for Culture & Arts Fest at CHS a success

a.span: CHS teacher one of 10 nationwide receiving tech grant

div.p: Clinton High School algebra teacher Heather McKinion is one of 10 teachers nationwide to receive a $3,000 classroom technology grant from Turning Technologies. McKinion said shes looking for solutions to close the mathematics achievement gap at Clinton High School.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS teacher one of 10 nationwide receiving tech grant

img.alt: CPSD to conduct 2018 summer school session

a.span: CPSD to conduct 2018 summer school session

div.p: Four schools in the Clinton Public School District will hold summer school from June 4 - July 13, with July 4 as a school holiday. Clinton High School, Sumner Hill Junior High, Clinton Junior High, and Lovett Elementary all received approval from the school board to conduct summer sessions. All of the classes will be held at CHS.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD to conduct 2018 summer school session

img.alt: Rising Arrow winners were recognized at the April board meeting.

a.span: Rising Arrow award recognizes students' character

div.p: A new award in Clintons public schools recognizes students for helping others around them in their school and community. The Rising Arrow Award is given to one student per school per nine-weeks period, based on recommendations from school counselors and teachers. Students are recognized at school board meetings and receive gifts from Wal-Mart and Chick-fil-A.

a.title: Go to comments for Rising Arrow award recognizes students' character

a.span: Vietnam veteran to receive honorary diploma

div.p: Larence Curtis Johnson was a student at Sumner Hill High School in the 1960s, and a football player. Between helping on the farm and going to school, I knew I had to make a living for me and my mother, he said. I knew the farm wasnt it. My charge was to go into service to make things better for my family.

a.title: Go to comments for Vietnam veteran to receive honorary diploma

img.alt: Students enrolling in CPSD this fall can begin the online pre-registration process in the spring.

a.span: Online Pre-Registration (all grades) begins this spring for 2018-19

div.p: Students enrolling in Clinton's public schools this fall can begin the online registration in the spring.

a.title: Go to comments for Online Pre-Registration (all grades) begins this spring for 2018-19

img.alt: There are six STAR Students in the CHS class of 2018

a.span: CHS names six STAR Students for 2018

div.p: Six seniors at Clinton High School scored 35 or 36 on the American College Test and have been designated STAR Students for 2018. STAR Students are selected on the basis of academic excellence. Both ACT scores and scholastic averages are compared to determine the schools STAR Students, said Vickie Powell of Jackson, senior vice president of foundations for the Mississippi Economic Council.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS names six STAR Students for 2018

img.alt: Archery is one of 18 Scholar Teams at CHS this year

div.p: All sports in Clintons public schools had a composite grade point average of at least 2.8. Eighteen of Clinton High Schools varsity teams have earned scholar team designation from the Mississippi High School Activities Association with a composite GPA of 3.0 or higher.

a.title: Go to comments for CPSD has 18 Scholar Teams

img.alt: Clinton Park students are holding a toothpaste drive at their school

a.span: Clinton Park students coordinate toothpaste drive

div.p: When a group of Clinton Park Elementary School first-graders recently visited Second Harvest food pantry, they learned that the organization was running low on toothpaste. They wanted to do something to help, so they decided to hold a toothpaste drive, said their teacher Myra Kinchen.

a.title: Go to comments for Clinton Park students coordinate toothpaste drive

img.alt: Joshua Wright (right) and CHS teacher and media club sponsor Robert Chapman

a.span: CHS student filmmaker featured at Crossroads Film Festival

div.p: Clinton High School junior Joshua Wright has spent the past two summers working as an intern at the Mississippi Youth Media Project. As part of this internship, he and other project members created the media package, From Woolworths Sit Ins to #BlackLivesMatter: Protesting for Life, Freedom and Dignity. The film will be featured at 1 p.m. Thursday, April 12 at Malco Grandview Cinema in Madison as part of the 2018 Crossroads Film Festival.

a.title: Go to comments for CHS student filmmaker featured at Crossroads Film Festival

img.alt: Kindergarten registration will be held April 17 at Clinton Park Elementary School

div.p: A kindergarten pre-registration day will be held at Clinton Park Elementary School, the Clinton Public School Districts kindergarten and first-grade school, from 4-7 p.m. April 17.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Pre-Registration begins April 17

img.alt: Sumner Hill students visited Clinton Park Elementary to read to first graders

a.span: Peer Guidance Committee sets tone at Sumner Hill

div.p: Ninth-grader Bethany Young said being on the Peer Guidance Committee carries a lot of weight at Sumner Hill Junior High. It helps us understand that the way we act can impact everyone around us, said her classmate, 14-year-old Cailyn Donaldson.

a.title: Go to comments for Peer Guidance Committee sets tone at Sumner Hill

a.span: Students encouraged to eat healthy breakfast

div.p: To encourage more families to take advantage of the healthy choices available for school breakfast, CPSD K-6 schools will celebrate National School Breakfast Week during March 5-9, 2018.

a.title: Go to comments for Students encouraged to eat healthy breakfast

img.alt: All five of CPSD's superintendents since 1970

a.span: Former CPSD superintendent receives Education Hero Award

div.p: The Mississippi Association of Partners in Education will present the first Education Heroes Award to public education champion Dr. Virgil Belue during the 16th annual Governors Awards luncheon on Tuesday, Feb. 27 at the Jackson Hilton.

a.title: Go to comments for Former CPSD superintendent receives Education Hero Award

div.span: The Clinton Public School District does not and shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers and vendors, and provision of services. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, students, parents, volunteers, vendors, and members of the public.
